snippet: But will they lead to less credit?
lead_paragraph: From John Tozzi at BusinessWeek we learn that Bank of America will extend to small-business accounts the protections recently granted to individual consumers by the Credit Card Accountability Responsibility and Disclosure Act of 2009. Between May and July, Bank of America will implement new policies for its two million small-business account holders that will end rate increases on existing balances, provide at least 45 days advance notice on rate changes for future balances, eliminate the over-limit fee, and set a grace period of at least 25 days between the statement closing date and the payment due date.

headline.main: Bank of America Grants New Credit Card Protections to Small Businesses
